location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 21 of 1866 from Lewis Pelly, Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bombay to Charles Gonne, Secretary to Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: Letter regarding the retrieval of merchandise from Muskat [Muscat] belonging to British Subjects, the possibility of rendering assistance to Hindoos [Hindus] who have merchandise there too and the need for any vessel retrieving these belongings to either be armed or be accompanied by a man 'o' war vessel. The letter goes on to discuss conversations with the Wahabees [Wahhabis] in order to maintain peace along the various frontiers and thoughts on how to provide a maritime police force for the Gulf.The Government reply No. 949 of 1866 to this letter can be found on the verso of folio 72.
